data.title: Scratch Video Vol. 1

data.text:
A programme of video art collected from this highly influential genre, which flourished in the UK in the mid-1990s. Scratch video made use of found images from film and television, cutting seemingly incongruous imagery together to make a new meaning – humorous, political and hard-hitting by turns. The new aesthetic was compared to the record-scratching techniques of hip hop, hence the name.

The two volumes feature the best short works from this period, and are available separately or as a single package.

UNTITLED George Barber 4 mins

UNTITLED Kim Flitcroft & Sandra Goldbacher 2 mins

UNTITLED Jeffrey Hinton 1 min

THE VOICE OF BRITAIN The Duvet Brothers 4 mins

UNTITLED John Scarlett Davis 2 mins

NIGHT OF 1000 EYES Kim Flitcroft & Sandra Goldbacher 2 mins

UNTITLED Jeffrey Hinton 2 mins

UNTITLED George Barber 5 mins

UNTITLED The Duvet Brothers 1 mins

UNTITLED John Maybury 2 mins
